param.name: arguments_file
param.label: Arguments_File
param.help: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line.

param.name: cloud_index_prefetch_buffer
param.label: Cloud Index Prefetch Buffer
param.help: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable). Defaults to cloudPrefetchBuffer if unset.

param.name: cloud_prefetch_buffer
param.label: Cloud Prefetch Buffer
param.help: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).

param.name: concordance
param.label: Concordance
param.help: Output variants also called in this comparison track. A site is considered concordant if (1) we are not looking for specific samples and there is a variant called in both the variant and concordance tracks or (2) every sample present in the variant track is present in the concordance track and they have the sample genotype call.

param.name: disable_bam_index_caching
param.label: Disable Bam Index Caching
param.help: If true, don't cache bam indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified. Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.

param.name: disable_sequence_dictionary_validation
param.label: Disable Sequence Dictionary Validation
param.help: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!.

param.name: discordance
param.label: Discordance
param.help: Output variants not called in this comparison track. A site is considered discordant if there exists some sample in the variant track that has a non-reference genotype and either the site isn't present in this track, the sample isn't present in this track, or the sample is called reference in this track.

param.name: drop_genotype_annotation
param.label: Drop Genotype Annotation
param.help: Genotype annotations to drop from output vcf. Annotations to be dropped are specified by their key. Genotype annotation fields to be dropped (specified by key)

param.name: drop_info_annotation
param.label: Drop Info Annotation
param.help: Info annotations to drop from output vcf. Annotations to be dropped are specified by their key. Info annotation fields to be dropped (specified by key)

param.name: exclude_filtered
param.label: Exclude Filtered
param.help: Don't include filtered sites. If this flag is enabled, sites that have been marked as filtered (i.e. have anything other than `.` or `PASS` in the FILTER field) will be excluded from the output.

param.name: exclude_ids
param.label: Exclude Ids
param.help: List of variant rsIDs to exclude. List of IDs (or a .list file containing ids) to exclude. The tool will exclude variants whose ID field is present in this list of IDs. The matching is done by exact string matching. If a file, the file name must end in ".list", and the expected file format is simply plain text with one ID per line.

param.name: exclude_non_variants
param.label: Exclude Non Variants
param.help: Don't include non-variant sites.

param.name: exclude_sample_expressions
param.label: Exclude Sample Expressions
param.help: List of sample expressions to exclude. Using a regular expression allows you to match multiple sample names that have that pattern in common. Note that sample exclusion takes precedence over inclusion, so that if a sample is in both lists it will be excluded. This argument can be specified multiple times in order to use multiple different matching patterns.

param.name: exclude_sample_name
param.label: Exclude Sample Name
param.help: Exclude genotypes from this sample. Note that sample exclusion takes precedence over inclusion, so that if a sample is in both lists it will be excluded. This argument can be specified multiple times in order to provide multiple sample names, or to specify the name of one or more files containing sample names. File names must use the extension ".args", and the expected file format is simply plain text with one sample name per line.

param.name: gcs_max_retries
param.label: Gcs Max Retries
param.help: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection.

param.name: genomicsdb_shared_posixfs_optimizations
param.label: Genomicsdb Shared Posixfs Optimizations
param.help: Allow for optimizations to improve the usability and performance for shared Posix Filesystems(e.g. NFS, Lustre). If set, file level locking is disabled and file system writes are minimized.

param.name: interval_merging_rule
param.label: Interval Merging Rule
param.help: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals. By default, the program merges abutting intervals (i.e. intervals that are directly side-by-side but do not actually overlap) into a single continuous interval. However you can change this behavior if you want them to be treated as separate intervals instead.

param.name: invert_mendelian_violation
param.label: Invert Mendelian Violation
param.help: Output non-mendelian violation sites only. If this flag is enabled, this tool will select only variants that do not correspond to a mendelian violation as determined on the basis of family structure. Requires passing a pedigree file using the engine-level `-ped` argument.

param.name: invertSelect
param.label: Invertselect
param.help: Invert the selection criteria for -select. Invert the selection criteria for -select.

param.name: keep_ids
param.label: Keep Ids
param.help: List of variant rsIDs to select. List of IDs (or a .list file containing ids) to select. The tool will only select variants whose ID field is present in this list of IDs. The matching is done by exact string matching. If a file, the file name must end in ".list", and the expected file format is simply plain text with one ID per line.

param.name: keep_original_ac
param.label: Keep Original Ac
param.help: Store the original AC, AF, and AN values after subsetting. When subsetting a callset, this tool recalculates the AC, AF, and AN values corresponding to the contents of the subset. If this flag is enabled, the original values of those annotations will be stored in new annotations called AC_Orig, AF_Orig, and AN_Orig.

param.name: keep_original_dp
param.label: Keep Original Dp
param.help: Store the original DP value after subsetting. When subsetting a callset, this tool recalculates the site-level (INFO field) DP value corresponding to the contents of the subset. If this flag is enabled, the original value of the DP annotation will be stored in a new annotation called DP_Orig.

param.name: max_filtered_genotypes
param.label: Max Filtered Genotypes
param.help: Maximum number of samples filtered at the genotype level. If this argument is provided, select sites where at most a maximum number of samples are filtered at the genotype level.

param.name: max_fraction_filtered_genotypes
param.label: Max Fraction Filtered Genotypes
param.help: Maximum fraction of samples filtered at the genotype level. If this argument is provided, select sites where a fraction or less of the samples are filtered at the genotype level.

param.name: max_indel_size
param.label: Max Indel Size
param.help: Maximum size of indels to include. If this argument is provided, indels that are larger than the specified size will be excluded.

param.name: max_nocall_fraction
param.label: Max Nocall Fraction
param.help: Maximum fraction of samples with no-call genotypes. If this argument is provided, select sites where at most the given fraction of samples have no-call genotypes.

param.name: max_nocall_number
param.label: Max Nocall Number
param.help: Maximum number of samples with no-call genotypes. If this argument is provided, select sites where at most the given number of samples have no-call genotypes.

param.name: mendelian_violation
param.label: Mendelian Violation
param.help: Output mendelian violation sites only. If this flag is enabled, this tool will select only variants that correspond to a mendelian violation as determined on the basis of family structure. Requires passing a pedigree file using the engine-level `-ped` argument.

param.name: mendelian_violation_qual_threshold
param.label: Mendelian Violation Qual Threshold
param.help: Minimum GQ score for each trio member to accept a site as a violation. This argument specifies the genotype quality (GQ) threshold that all members of a trio must have in order for a site to be accepted as a mendelian violation. Note that the `-mv` flag must be set for this argument to have an effect.

param.name: min_filtered_genotypes
param.label: Min Filtered Genotypes
param.help: Minimum number of samples filtered at the genotype level. If this argument is provided, select sites where at least a minimum number of samples are filtered at the genotype level.

param.name: min_fraction_filtered_genotypes
param.label: Min Fraction Filtered Genotypes
param.help: Maximum fraction of samples filtered at the genotype level. If this argument is provided, select sites where a fraction or more of the samples are filtered at the genotype level.

param.name: min_indel_size
param.label: Min Indel Size
param.help: Minimum size of indels to include. If this argument is provided, indels that are smaller than the specified size will be excluded.

param.name: pedigree
param.label: Pedigree
param.help: Pedigree file.

param.name: preserve_alleles
param.label: Preserve Alleles
param.help: Preserve original alleles, do not trim. The default behavior of this tool is to remove bases common to all remaining alleles after subsetting operations have been completed, leaving only their minimal representation. If this flag is enabled, the original alleles will be preserved as recorded in the input VCF.

param.name: remove_fraction_genotypes
param.label: Remove Fraction Genotypes
param.help: Select a fraction of genotypes at random from the input and sets them to no-call. The value of this argument should be a number between 0 and 1 specifying the fraction of total variants to be randomly selected from the input callset and set to no-call (./). Note that this is done using a probabilistic function, so the final result is not guaranteed to carry the exact fraction requested. Can be used for large fractions.

param.name: remove_unused_alternates
param.label: Remove Unused Alternates
param.help: Remove alternate alleles not present in any genotypes. When this flag is enabled, all alternate alleles that are not present in the (output) samples will be removed. Note that this even extends to biallelic SNPs - if the alternate allele is not present in any sample, it will be removed and the record will contain a '.' in the ALT column. Note also that sites-only VCFs, by definition, do not include the alternate allele in any genotype calls.

param.name: restrict_alleles_to
param.label: Restrict Alleles To
param.help: Select only variants of a particular allelicity. When this argument is used, we can choose to include only multiallelic or biallelic sites, depending on how many alleles are listed in the ALT column of a VCF. For example, a multiallelic record such as: 1 100 . A AAA,AAAAA will be excluded if `-restrict-alleles-to BIALLELIC` is used, because there are two alternate alleles, whereas a record such as: 1 100 . A T will be included in that case, but would be excluded if `-restrict-alleles-to MULTIALLELIC` is used. Valid options are ALL (default), MULTIALLELIC or BIALLELIC.

param.name: sample_expressions
param.label: Sample Expressions
param.help: Regular expression to select multiple samples. Using a regular expression allows you to match multiple sample names that have that pattern in common. This argument can be specified multiple times in order to use multiple different matching patterns.

param.name: sample_name
param.label: Sample Name
param.help: Include genotypes from this sample. This argument can be specified multiple times in order to provide multiple sample names, or to specify the name of one or more files containing sample names. File names must use the extension ".args", and the expected file format is simply plain text with one sample name per line. Note that sample exclusion takes precedence over inclusion, so that if a sample is in both lists it will be excluded.

param.name: select_random_fraction
param.label: Select Random Fraction
param.help: Select a fraction of variants at random from the input. The value of this argument should be a number between 0 and 1 specifying the fraction of total variants to be randomly selected from the input callset. Note that this is done using a probabilistic function, so the final result is not guaranteed to carry the exact fraction requested. Can be used for large fractions.

param.name: select_type_to_exclude
param.label: Select Type To Exclude
param.help: Do not select certain type of variants from the input file. This argument excludes particular kinds of variants out of a list. If left empty, there is no type selection and all variant types are considered for other selection criteria. Valid types are INDEL, SNP, MIXED, MNP, SYMBOLIC, NO_VARIATION. Can be specified multiple times.

param.name: select_type_to_include
param.label: Select Type To Include
param.help: Select only a certain type of variants from the input file. This argument selects particular kinds of variants out of a list. If left empty, there is no type selection and all variant types are considered for other selection criteria. Valid types are INDEL, SNP, MIXED, MNP, SYMBOLIC, NO_VARIATION. Can be specified multiple times.

param.name: selectExpressions
param.label: Selectexpressions
param.help: One or more criteria to use when selecting the data. See example commands above for detailed usage examples. Note that these expressions are evaluated *after* the specified samples are extracted and the INFO field annotations are updated.

param.name: set_filtered_gt_to_nocall
param.label: Set Filtered Gt To Nocall
param.help: Set filtered genotypes to no-call. If this argument is provided, set filtered genotypes to no-call (./.).

param.name: sites_only_vcf_output
param.label: Sites Only Vcf Output
param.help: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing vcf file output.

param.name: genomicsdb_use_bcf_codec
param.label: Genomicsdb Use Bcf Codec
param.help: Use BCF Codec Streaming for data from GenomicsDB instead of the default VCFCodec. BCFCodec performs slightly better but currently does not support 64-bit width positions and INFO fields and for computed annotation sizes to exceed 32-bit integer space. Currently there is no support for 64-bit fields in BCF2Codec. The VCFCodec allows for 64-bit width positions and INFO fields and for computed annotation sizes to exceed the 32-bit integer space while encoding/decoding with GenomicsDB. Use the BCF2Codec option if and only if performance is an issue.

param.name: add_output_sam_program_record
param.label: Add Output Sam Program Record
param.help: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.

param.name: add_output_vcf_command_line
param.label: Add Output Vcf Command Line
param.help: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.

param.name: disable_read_filter
param.label: Disable Read Filter
param.help: Read filters to be disabled before analysis.

param.name: disable_tool_default_read_filters
param.label: Disable Tool Default Read Filters
param.help: Disable all tool default read filters (WARNING: many tools will not function correctly without their default read filters on).

param.name: gatk_config_file
param.label: Gatk Config File
param.help: A configuration file to use with the GATK.

param.name: interval_set_rule
param.label: Interval Set Rule
param.help:
Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs. By default, the program will take the UNION of all intervals specified using -L and/or -XL. However, you can change this setting for -L, for example if you want to take the INTERSECTION of the sets instead. E.g. to perform the analysis only on chromosome 1 exomes, you could specify -L exomes.intervals -L 1 --interval-set-rule INTERSECTION. However, it is not possible to modify the merging approach for intervals passed using -XL (they will always be merged using UNION).
Note that if you specify both -L and -XL, the -XL interval set will be subtracted from the -L interval set.

param.name: lenient
param.label: Lenient
param.help: Lenient processing of VCF files.

param.name: QUIET
param.label: Quiet
param.help: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.

param.name: read_filter
param.label: Read Filter
param.help: Read filters to be applied before analysis.

param.name: read_validation_stringency
param.label: Read Validation Stringency
param.help: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program. The default stringency value SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.

param.name: seconds_between_progress_updates
param.label: Seconds Between Progress Updates
param.help: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse.

param.name: tmp_dir
param.label: Tmp Dir
param.help: Temp directory to use.

param.name: use_jdk_deflater
param.label: Use Jdk Deflater
param.help: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater).

param.name: use_jdk_inflater
param.label: Use Jdk Inflater
param.help: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater).

param.name: verbosity
param.label: Verbosity
param.help: Control verbosity of logging.

tool.help:
Select a subset of variants from a VCF file
This tool makes it possible to select a subset of variants based on various criteria in order to facilitate certain analyses. Examples of such analyses include comparing and contrasting cases vs. controls, extracting variant or non-variant loci that meet certain requirements, or troubleshooting some unexpected results, to name a few.
There are many different options for selecting subsets of variants from a larger callset:
- Extract one or more samples from a callset based on either a complete sample name or a pattern match. - Specify criteria for inclusion that place thresholds on annotation values, e.g. "DP > 1000" (depth of coverage greater than 1000x), "AF < 0.25" (sites with allele frequency less than 0.25). These criteria are written as "JEXL expressions", which are documented in the `article about using JEXL expressions <https://gatk.broadinstitute.org/hc/en-us/articles/360035891011-JEXL-filtering-expressions>`__. - Provide concordance or discordance tracks in order to include or exclude variants that are also present in other given callsets. - Select variants based on criteria like their type (e.g. INDELs only), evidence of mendelian violation, filtering status, allelicity, etc.
There are also several options for recording the original values of certain annotations which are recalculated when one subsets the new callset, trims alleles, etc.
Input ~~~~~
A variant call set in VCF format from which a subset can be selected.
Output ~~~~~~
A new VCF file containing the selected subset of variants.
\*
Usage examples ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Select SNPs ^^^^^^^^^^^
::
gatk SelectVariants \ -R Homo_sapiens_assembly38.fasta \ -V input.vcf \ --select-type-to-include SNP \ -O output.vcf
Query Chromosome 20 Variants from a GenomicsDB ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
::
gatk SelectVariants \ -R Homo_sapiens_assembly38.fasta \ -V gendb://genomicsDB \ -L 20 \ -O output.chr20.vcf
